left.name: program_id
left.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

meta.notes: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Program Services area. For example, TEST-CA is a Program ID.

right.name: program_id
right.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

meta.notes: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Submission area. For example, PACA-CA is a Program ID.

notes.data: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Submission area. For example, PACA-CA is a Program ID.

left.name: submitter_donor_id
left.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

meta.notes: To prevent data collisions, submitter_id cannot begin with any of the ARGO ID prefixes.  The restricted prefixes include: `DO`, `SP`, `SA`,`TR`,`FU`, `PD`.

left.name: submitter_primary_diagnosis_id
left.description: Indicate the primary diagnosis event in the clinical timeline that this specimen acquisition was related to.

meta.notes: To prevent data collisions, submitter_id cannot begin with any of the ARGO ID prefixes.  The restricted prefixes include: `DO`, `SP`, `SA`,`TR`,`FU`, `PD`.

left.name: pathological_stage_group
left.description: Specify the tumour stage, based on pathological_tumour_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

meta.notes:
This field depends on the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

right.name: pathological_stage_group
right.description: Specify the tumour stage, based on tumour_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

meta.notes: This field depends on the selected pathological staging system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

description.data: Specify the tumour stage, based on tumour_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

notes.data: This field depends on the selected pathological staging system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

left.name: specimen_acquisition_interval
left.description: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days.

meta.notes: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

right.name: specimen_acquisition_interval
right.description: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days.

meta.notes: The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

notes.data: The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

left.name: reference_pathology_confirmed
left.description: Indicate whether the pathological diagnosis was confirmed by a (central) reference pathologist.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: reference_pathology_confirmed
right.description: Indicate whether the pathological diagnosis was confirmed by a (central) reference pathologist. This only applies to clinical studies.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

description.data: Indicate whether the pathological diagnosis was confirmed by a (central) reference pathologist. This only applies to clinical studies.

left.name: tumour_grade
left.description: Grade of the tumour as assigned by the reporting tumour_grading_system.

meta.notes:
This field depends on the selected tumour_grading_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Grading Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-grading-classifications

right.name: tumour_grade
right.description: Grade of the tumour as assigned by the reporting tumour_grading_system.

meta.notes: This field depends on the selected tumour grading system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

notes.data: This field depends on the selected tumour grading system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

left.name: cancer_type_additional_information
left.description: Additional details related to the cancer type that are not covered by the ICD-10 code provided in the cancer_type field.

data.name: cancer_type_additional_information
data.description: Additional details related to the cancer type that are not covered by the ICD-10 code provided in the cancer_type field.

left.name: clinical_stage_group
left.description: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting clinical_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

meta.notes:
This field is dependent on the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

right.name: clinical_stage_group
right.description: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

meta.notes: This field is dependent on the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system

description.data: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

notes.data: This field is dependent on the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system

left.name: clinical_n_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: clinical_n_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

description.data: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: clinical_m_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: clinical_m_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.

left.name: presenting_symptoms
left.description: Indicate presenting symptoms at time of primary diagnosis.

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

right.description: Indicate presenting symptoms at time of primary diagnosis.

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

left.name: performance_status
left.description: Indicate the donor's performance status grade at the time of primary diagnosis. (Reference source: ECOG performance score grades from https://ecog-acrin.org/resources/ecog-performance-status).

meta.notes:
Grade 0: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.
Grade 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature (ie. Light house work, office work).
Grade 2: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours.
Grade 3: Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.
Grade 4: Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair

right.name: performance_status
right.description: Indicate the donor's performance status grade at the time of primary diagnosis. (Reference source: ECOG performance score grades from https://ecog-acrin.org/resources/ecog-performance-status).

meta.notes:
Grade 0: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction 
 Grade 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature (ie. Light house work, office work) 
 Grade 2: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours 
 Grade 3: Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours 
 Grade 4: Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair

notes.data:
Grade 0: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction 
 Grade 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature (ie. Light house work, office work) 
 Grade 2: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours 
 Grade 3: Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours 
 Grade 4: Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair

left.name: treatment_type
left.description: Indicate the type of treatment regimen that the donor completed.

meta.notes:
Depending on the treatment_type(s) selected, additional treatment details may be required to be submitted. For example, if treatment_type includes 'Chemotherapy', the supplemental Chemotherapy treatment type file is required.
To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

right.name: treatment_type
right.description: Indicate the type of treatment regimen that the donor completed.

codeList: Combined chemotherapy, radiation therapy and surgery

meta.notes: Depending on the treatment_type selected, additional treatment details may be required to be submitted. For example, if treatment_type includes 'Chemotherapy', the supplemental Chemotherapy treatment type file is required.

added: Combined chemotherapy, radiation therapy and surgery

notes.data: Depending on the treatment_type selected, additional treatment details may be required to be submitted. For example, if treatment_type includes 'Chemotherapy', the supplemental Chemotherapy treatment type file is required.

Surgical and medical procedures - Other, specify

left.name: drug_rxnormcui
left.description: The unique RxNormID assigned to the treatment regimen drug.

meta.notes:
This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin or https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/search?searchBy=String&searchTerm=leucovorin

right.name: drug_rxnormcui
right.description: The unique RxNormID assigned to the treatment regimen drug.

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin

notes.data:

left.name: submitter_donor_id
left.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

meta.notes: To prevent data collisions, submitter_id cannot begin with any of the ARGO ID prefixes.  The restricted prefixes include: `DO`, `SP`, `SA`,`TR`,`FU`, `PD`.

left.description: Unique identifier for a follow-up event in a donor's clinical record, assigned by the data provider.
left.name: submitter_follow_up_id

meta.notes: To prevent data collisions, submitter_id cannot begin with any of the ARGO ID prefixes.  The restricted prefixes include: `DO`, `SP`, `SA`,`TR`,`FU`, `PD`.

notes.data: To prevent data collisions, submitter_id cannot begin with any of the ARGO ID prefixes.  The restricted prefixes include: `DO`, `SP`, `SA`,`TR`,`FU`, `PD`.

left.description: Interval from the primary diagnosis date to the follow-up date, in days.
left.name: interval_of_followup

meta.notes: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

right.description: Interval from the primary diagnosis date to the follow-up date, in days.
right.name: interval_of_followup

meta.notes: The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

notes.data: The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

left.name: submitter_primary_diagnosis_id

left.description: If the donor was clinically disease free following primary treatment and then relapse or recurrence or progression (for liquid tumours) occurred afterwards, then this field will indicate the length of disease free interval, in days.
left.name: relapse_interval

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

right.description: If the donor was clinically disease free following primary treatment and then relapse or recurrence or progression (for liquid tumours) occurred afterwards, then this field will indicate the length of disease free interval, in days.
right.name: relapse_interval

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

left.description: Indicate the method(s) used to confirm the donor's progression or relapse or recurrence disease status. (Codelist reference: NCI CDE ID: 6161031)
left.name: method_of_progression_status

codeList: Biomarker in liquid biopsy (e.g. tumour marker in blood or urine)

meta.notes:
This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.
To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

right.description: Indicate the method(s) used to confirm the donor's progression or relapse or recurrence disease status. (Codelist reference: NCI CDE ID: 6161031)
right.name: method_of_progression_status

codeList: Biomarker in liquid biopsy (e.g. tumour marker in blood or urine)

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence

notes.data: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence

left.description: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic site where disease progression, relapse or recurrence occurred, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.
left.name: anatomic_site_progression_or_recurrences

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

right.description: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic site where disease progression or recurrence occurred, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.
right.name: anatomic_site_progression_or_recurrences

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

description.data: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic site where disease progression or recurrence occurred, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

left.name: recurrence_t_category
left.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: recurrence_t_category
right.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

description.data: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: recurrence_n_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: recurrence_n_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

description.data: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: recurrence_m_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: recurrence_m_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

description.data: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: recurrence_stage_group
left.description: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting recurrence_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression.

meta.notes:
This field is dependent on the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

right.name: recurrence_stage_group
right.description: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting recurrence_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery.

meta.notes: This field is dependent on the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system.

description.data: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting recurrence_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery.

notes.data: This field is dependent on the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected posttherapy_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.
